results.title: Plants and people
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and Robin Wischusen
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
This program examines issues related to commercial farming considering the industry aspects of employment, economic value, the relationship between human dependence on plants and plant production, and the impact of technology. Examines the selective breeding used in the domestication of wheat and the use of genetic biology to provide a wider variety of product.

results.title: Plants and light
results.creator_credit: Czechoslovak State Film, Milan Hachla and Jan Calabek
results.brief_description: With light all plant life would be limited to fungi, for light, like water, is essential to plant growth. Experiments with potatoes demonstrate how, as spring approaches, stalks feel their way towards the nearest light source. Explains that light is essential because it is the means by which the leaves can produce starch from water and carbon dioxide. Uses time lapse photography.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Czechoslovak State Film, Milan Hachla and Jan Calabek
results.description: With light all plant life would be limited to fungi, for light, like water, is essential to plant growth. results.title: Plants and animals depend on each other
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Media and William Coss
results.brief_description: Allows children to investigate the question - why is it that plants and animals always seem to live together? As they observe relationships among plants and animals in an aquarium, in ponds, woodlands, grass lands, and in the ocean. Food, shelter, transportation, oxygen, carbon dioxide and reproduction are some of the needs and processes examined.

results.title: Planting quarantine bunchy top
results.brief_description: Brief, unedited footage, largely comprised of shots of banana plantations in Queensland. Nice shots of bunchs of bananas being hoisted through the plantations and suntanned men working. Rich colour. Film tin reads ‘Takes 31-32-33-34’.

results.title: Planting and transplanting at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden
results.creator_credit: Center for Mass Communication of Columbia University and Sumner J. Glimcher
results.brief_description: Demonstrates planting and transplanting of flowers, shrubs and trees, covering seeds, bulbs and plants, root and top pruning, potting, watering, mulching and soil preparation.

results.title: Plantation in Peru
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Film Enterprises and Clifford J. Kamen
results.brief_description: Sketches the process of irrigation and sugar growing in an almost rainless desert between the Andes and the Pacific Ocean. Shows levelling land for irrigation, planting of cane, burning off and harvesting. Gives glimpses of bull-fighting and the life of Peruvian villagers.

results.title: Plant tropisms and other movements
results.brief_description: Illustrates the essential movements of several common plants in response to internal and external stimuli. Differentiates between three basic types of movement: tropistic, nastic and nutational. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Plant traps
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the pitcher plant lures insects to its trap, where they drown. The sundew, another carnivorous plant, is shown throughout its life cycle. The enfolding of insects by its leaf tentacles is presented by means of time-lapse photography.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
